titleStmt.title: Letter from Clara White to Eartha White. March 16, 1896.
titleStmt.author: Clara White

respStmt.name: Lydia P. Stewart and Janaya Ferrer

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author writes to Eartha White about the package that Eartha sent her.

objectDesc.p: A two-page letter handwritten on a lined paper.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

body.p:
I received your dear letter
and was happy to herehear from you.
I hope you are well as it leaves
me at present. I received the two
packages also, My pictures and
I was so proud of my pictures.
I think they are fine they are
just lovely. Every one that Seesee them
say they are just grand. I gave
one to papar and one to Bell
and keep one my selfmyself. youYou said
I would be surprised and I really
was. I also thank you for my dress
and Bell give her best regards and
thank you kindly for her dress. She
says that puzzle is just grand and our
two old aunt that you sent us.
I am glad to herehear that you went to
see our Robins he was so proud of
it that he wrote me all about it. Some of the boys on the [illegible] Sayssays that that
they saw you and you just as Sweetsweet
as a peach Este Barnlock is married
and gone to charge on her bridal tour.
I were at the wedding. She looks sweet.
I cannot tell you when I will
be able to come North as I am not
quite through with my business in
Washington as yet and I would
like very much to finish that before
I leave home.

Now Dear I must close.
Goodly pray for Meme
and Bell that god bless
us
